name: Aerospace Industries Association (AIA)
bossPosition: Chief Financial Office & Secretary/Treasurer to the Board
membership: AIA is a member of the International Coordinating Council of Aerospace Industries Association (ICCAIA), which, at the time of this submission, represents the aerospace associations of the United States, Europe, Brazil, Canada, Japan, and Russia. More information on ICCAIA can be found at: http://www.iccaia.org/

https://www.aia-aerospace.org/membership/our-members/
goal:
The Aerospace Industries Association (AIA) is the most authoritative and influential trade association representing the U.S. aerospace and defense industry on Capitol Hill, within the U.S. administration and internationally.
AIA seeks to present a unified voice on behalf of American aerospace and defense companies and advocate on behalf of our members for policies and funding that promote the aerospace and defense sector, a strong U.S. industrial base, defense modernization, and an efficient acquisition system.
In addition, AIA works to accelerate deployment of Next Generation Air Transportation System (NexGen) technologies and equipment, promote the use of Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAS), modernize export controls, obtain additional resources for research and development and space exploration, and address workforce issues throughout the industry. We are also a leader in developing and publishing national aerospace standards that are used in aerospace design and manufacturing across the globe.
interests: Climate Action, Competition, Customs, Energy, Environment, External Relations, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Research and innovation, Trade, Transport
euInitiatives:
AIA does not routinely engage with EU institutions on any policies or issues, but we do monitor developments in a number of areas that could affect our member companies. These include, but are not limited to:
Civil Aviation: Aviation safety, aviation product certification and standards, unmanned aerial systems, airspace, other European aviation issues including those related to ICAO.
Environment: REACH and other chemical and materials issues, climate change, greenhouse gas emissions and environmental performance standards.
Defense: Permanent Structured Cooperation (PESCO) on Defense and European Defense Industrial Development Program.
